    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    calculateActiveMinutesWeekly()
    Calculate total (NOT average) active minutes of the week
    double
    calculateCalorieDeficit()
    Calculate calorie deficit by subtracting maintenanceCalories with caloriesBurnedDaily; Both variables are double so the result can be negative If one of the variables are negative, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
    double
    calculateDistance()
    Calculate daily walking distance by taking the daily steps taken multiply with FEMALE_WALK or MALE_WALK, based on gender

    Determine fitness level based on calculateActiveMinutesWeekly() method and caloriesBurnedDaily variable The calories condition is based on daily calories, resemble the sample output.

  • Constructor Details

    • FitnessTracker

      public FitnessTracker()
      Default constructor with no parameter to print out a message

    • FitnessTracker

      public FitnessTracker(String firstName, String lastName, String gender, int stepsTakenDaily, int caloriesBurnedDaily, double activeMinutesDaily, int maintenanceCalories)
      Constructor takes all 7 arguments and assigned it to instance variables. Works like a setter
      Parameters:
      firstName - First name
      lastName - Last name
      gender - Gender
      stepsTakenDaily - Daily steps taken
      caloriesBurnedDaily - Calories burned per day
      activeMinutesDaily - Minutes exercising per day
      maintenanceCalories - Maintenance calories needs to burn

    • calculateDistance

      public double calculateDistance()
      Calculate daily walking distance by taking the daily steps taken multiply with FEMALE_WALK or MALE_WALK, based on gender
      Returns:
      daily distance calculated

    • calculateActiveMinutesWeekly

      public double calculateActiveMinutesWeekly()
      Calculate total (NOT average) active minutes of the week
      Returns:
      daily active minutes multiply by 7 days

    • calculateFitnessLevel

      public String calculateFitnessLevel()
      Determine fitness level based on calculateActiveMinutesWeekly() method and caloriesBurnedDaily variable The calories condition is based on daily calories, resemble the sample output. If invalid arguments, return String "Error".
      Returns:
      fitness level determined

    • calculateCalorieDeficit

      public double calculateCalorieDeficit()
      Calculate calorie deficit by subtracting maintenanceCalories with caloriesBurnedDaily; Both variables are double so the result can be negative If one of the variables are negative, IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
      Returns:
      differences between maintenanceCalories and caloriesBurnedDaily

    • displayFitnessData

      public void displayFitnessData()
      Display all fitness data data. Uses printf to format double data type to contains only 1 decimal place
